intro: Aster purpureus, commonly known as purple coneflower, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flower heads that are surrounded by a series of pale yellow to white ray flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its scientific name reflects its distinctive conical center, which is composed of numerous tubular flowers. Aster purpureus is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
